questions.question_text: If the HSP_VIEW dimension exists in the cube, what feature has been enabled? (Choose the best answer.)
In Data Management, what are the steps you need to perform to synchronize the application metadata in the target application? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Correct Answer : C 
In question, it has asked to refresh members and not Dimensions/segments

Selected Answer: D
D is the right answer
D should be correct because of 'Metadata' refresh
C is correct answer as If not all dimensions are displayed, click Refresh Metadata but if all meta data than Refresh members

comments.content: In question you can find word metadata, not members. Because of this I think correct answare is D.

discussion.content: D is definitely the correct answer but what is the question is only pertaining to one member refresh in a dimension.
I think D is more complete because covers situations where new dimensions are added
Correct Answer: D
I think D is the correct answer.

choices.D: In Data Management, to Target Application and select your Planning application. Click Refresh Metadata.
choices.B: In Data Management, navigate to Import Format and select your Planning application. Click Refresh Dimensions.
choices.C: In Data Management, navigate to Target Application and select your Planning application. Click Refresh Members.
choices.A: In Data Management, navigate to Application Dimensions and click Refresh Dimensions.

discussion.content: I think answer should be C
c IS right answer
should be C

questions.question_text: In order to be able to configure Additional Earnings in the Benefits and Taxes wizard, into which dimension do you have to import members? Choose the best answer.
Which three describe what you can do with Valid Intersections? (Choose three.)

choices.D: prevent the user from executing any type of Calculation Manager rule that uses runtime prompts
choices.E: allow all users to select from a non-filtered list of members on the form's point of view
choices.B: restrict cells containing invalid data, setting them to a read-only state within forms.
choices.A: specify that certain programs are valid only for some periods or departments.
choices.C: filter cell intersections to users when they enter data or select runtime prompts

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: ABC
Explanation: Valid intersections enable you to define rules, called valid intersection rules, which filter certain cell intersections to users when they enter data or select runtime prompts. For example, you can specify that certain programs are valid only for some periods or departments.
After valid intersections are defined, cells containing invalid data are read-only. This restriction speeds the planning process and optimizes the information available to users.
Reference: https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/planning-budgeting-cloud/pfusa/val_comb.html

B C E
The referenced link says "Application users can reset the point of view to the default, unfiltered list without closing and reopening the form by clearing the selections." So I think E is correct and not A.
 https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/planning-budgeting-cloud/pfusa/working_with_valid_intersections_in_application_forms.html

Correct answer is A,B,C 
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/planning-budgeting-cloud/pfusa/val_comb.html
B C and E

questions.question_text: Which three accounts in Workforce leverage the Component dimension for driver and trend-based calculations? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: This questions refers to Finance module, not workforce. The answer in that case is correct: A,B,C
